did.unittitle: Thomas and William H. Smith papers
did.abstract: This collection consists of agreements and leases dating from 1884 to 1903 and relating to Thomas and William H. Smith's connection to properties on Front and Broad Streets in New York City through their roles as Committee and Trustee of N. Denton of Geneva, N.Y. and Guardian of Louise A. Gormly of Rochester, N.Y.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Thomas and William H. Smith papers, 1977.546, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consist of agreements and leases dating from 1884 to 1903. The papers relate to Thomas and William H. Smith's connection to properties on Front and Broad Streets in New York City through their roles as Committee and Trustee of N. Denton of Geneva, N.Y. and Guardian of Louise A. Gormly of Rochester, N.Y.
